sen.j: 天河大弁財天社（てんかわだいべんざいてんしゃ、天河神社）は、奈良県吉野郡天川村坪内にある神社である。
sen.e: Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine (or Tenkawa-jinja Shrine) is a Shinto shrine located in Tsubonouchi, Tenkawa Village, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine (or Tenkawa-jinja Shrine) is a Shinto shrine located in Tsubonouchi, Tenkawa Village, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine (or Tenkawa-jinja Shrine) is a Shinto shrine located in Tsubonouchi, Tenkawa Village, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 祭神
sen.e: Enshrined deity
Enshrined Deities
Enshrined Deities

sen.j: イチキシマヒメ（いちきしまひめのみこと）を主祭神とする。
sen.e: The main enshrined deity is Ichikishimahime (or Ichikishimahime-no-mikoto).
The main enshrined deity is Ichikishimahime (or Ichikishimahime-no-mikoto).
The main enshrined deity is Ichikishimahime (or Ichikishimahime-no-mikoto).

sen.j: 芸能の神として知られ、現在も芸能関係の参拝が多い。
sen.e: Since it is known as a deity of public entertainments, this shrine is popular among people related to show business even now.
Since it is known as a deity of public entertainments, this shrine is popular among people related to show business even now.
Since it is known as a deity of public entertainments, this shrine is popular among people related to show business even now.

sen.j: 元の祭神名は弁才天（サラスヴァティー）。
sen.e: The original name of the enshrined deity was Benzaiten (Sarasvati).
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The original name of the enshrined deity was Benzaiten (Sarasvati).
The original name of the enshrined deity was Benzaiten (Sarasvati).

sen.j: 神仏分離により「市杵島姫命」と称するようになったものである。
sen.e: After an execution of the Edict for Separation of Shinto and Buddhism, the deity has come to be called 'Ichikishimahime-no-mikoto.'
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After the execution of the edict for the separation of Shinto and Buddhism, the deity has came to be called 'Ichikishimahime-no-mikoto.'
After the execution of the edict for the separation of Shinto and Buddhism, the deity has came to be called 'Ichikishimahime-no-mikoto.'

sen.j: 今日でも社名に「弁財天」とついている通り、「弁財天」としても信仰されている。
sen.e: As shown in the shrine name of Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine that includes the word 'Benzaiten,' the shrine is also believed as a shrine enshrining 'Benzaiten.'
As shown by the shrine name 'Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha' Shrine which includes the word 'Benzaiten,' the shrine is also believed to enshrine 'Benzaiten.'
As shown by the shrine name 'Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha' Shrine which includes the word 'Benzaiten,' the shrine is also believed to enshrine 'Benzaiten.'

sen.j: 「厳島、竹生島と並ぶ日本三大弁財天のひとつ」と称している（他に江の島の江島神社も日本三大弁財天と称している）。
sen.e: The shrine boasts itself to be one of Japan's three major shrines enshrining Benzaiten along with Itsukushima-benzaiten and Chikubujima-jinja Shrine (Enoshima-jinja Shrine in Enoshima also gives its name as a shrine included in Japan's three major shrines enshrining Benzaiten).

The shrine is one of Japan's three major shrines enshrining Benzaiten along with Itsukushima-benzaiten and Chikubujima-jinja Shrine (Enoshima-jinja Shrine in Enoshima also claims to be one of Japan's three major shrines enshrining Benzaiten).

The shrine is one of Japan's three major shrines enshrining Benzaiten along with Itsukushima-benzaiten and Chikubujima-jinja Shrine (Enoshima-jinja Shrine in Enoshima also claims to be one of Japan's three major shrines enshrining Benzaiten).

sen.j: 他に、熊野三山、吉野坐大神、南朝 (日本)四代天皇の御霊（後醍醐天皇、後村上天皇、長慶天皇、後亀山天皇）、神代天之御中主神より百柱の神が配祀されている。
sen.e: In addition, Kumanunimasu-okami, Yoshinonimasu-okami, the departed souls of four emperors reigned the Japan's Southern Court (the Emperor Godaigo, the Emperor Gomurakami, the Emperor Chokei and the Emperor Gokameyama) and 100 mythological deities from Amenominakanushi-no-kami are enshrined.
sen.cmt: 熊野三山はウェブでは熊野坐大神でしたので訂正しました。
sen.e: In addition, Kumanunimasu-okami, Yoshinonimasu-okami, the departed souls of four emperors of Japan's Southern Court (Emperor Godaigo, Emperor Gomurakami, Emperor Chokei and Emperor Gokameyama) and 100 mythological deities from Amenominakanushi-no-kami are enshrined.

In addition, Kumano Sanzan (three major shrines, Kumano-Hongu-Taisha, Kumano-Hayatama-Taisha and Kumano-Nachi-Taisha), Yoshinonimasu-okami, the departed souls of four emperors of Japan's Southern Court (Emperor Godaigo, Emperor Gomurakami, Emperor Chokei and Emperor Gokameyama) and 100 mythological deities from Amenominakanushi-no-kami are enshrined.
sen.cmt: 熊野三山＝Kumano Sanzan (three major shrines, Kumano-Hongu-Taisha, Kumano-Hayatama-Taisha and Kumano-Nachi-Taisha)としました。

sen.j: 天川村の弁才天は普段見る事が出来ず、60年に1度の御開帳の時には能楽を始め『例大祭』が行われる。
sen.e: Benzaiten enshrined in Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine is usually closed to public except a special event of Gokaicho (unveiling an image) held once 60 years, when 'Reitai-sai Festival' is held and various performances including Nohgaku (the art of Noh) are presented.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Benzaiten enshrined in Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine is usually closed to the public except during the special event of gokaicho (unveiling an image) held once every 60 years, when the 'Reitai-sai Festival' is held and various performances including nohgaku (the art of noh) are presented.

Benzaiten enshrined in Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine is usually closed to the public except during the special event of gokaicho (unveiling an image) held once every 60 years, when the 'Reitai-sai Festival' is held and various performances including nohgaku (the art of noh) are presented.

sen.j: 全国各地から観光客や信者が天川村へ参拝に来る。
sen.e: Lots of tourists and believers from all over the country visit Tenkawa Village to pray.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Many of tourists and believers from all over the country visit Tenkawa Village to worship.
Many of tourists and believers from all over the country visit Tenkawa Village to worship.

sen.j: 特に芸能関係者の信仰があつく、著名人が東京を始め全国各地からもたくさん参詣に来る。
sen.e: As this shrine enjoys quite high popularity among people related to show business, many celebrities from Tokyo and other districts nationwide visit the shrine.
As this shrine enjoys quite high popularity among people related to show business, many celebrities from Tokyo and other districts nationwide visit the shrine.
As this shrine enjoys quite high popularity among people related to show business, many celebrities from Tokyo and other districts nationwide visit the shrine.

sen.j: ちなみに最近の御開帳は2008年7月18日。
sen.e: By the way, the latest Gokaicho was held on July 18, 2008.
The most recent Gokaicho was held on July 18, 2008.
The most recent Gokaicho was held on July 18, 2008.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 700年頃（飛鳥時代）、役小角が同じ天川村の大峰山を開山し修験道をはじめる前にここで修行を行った。
sen.e: En-no-Ozunu (EN-no-Gyoja) practiced asceticism in this district before founding the practice place of Shugendo (Japanese ascetic and shamanistic practice in mountainous sites) in Mt. Omine of Tenkawa Village in around 700 (in the Asuka period).

Circa 700, EN no Ozunu (EN no Gyoja) founded a temple at the top of Mt. Omine in Tenkawa Village where he practiced asceticism before founding Shugendo (Japanese ascetic and shamanistic practice in mountainous sites).

Circa 700, EN no Ozunu (EN no Gyoja) founded a temple at the top of Mt. Omine in Tenkawa Village where he practiced asceticism before founding Shugendo (Japanese ascetic and shamanistic practice in mountainous sites).

sen.j: 役行者が始めたと多門院日記に記述されている。
sen.e: Tamonin Diary describes that EN-no-Gyoja founded Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine.
The Tamonin Diary describes that EN no Gyoja founded Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine.
The Tamonin Diary describes that EN no Gyoja founded Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine.

sen.j: 大峯蔵王権現に先立って、最高峰である弥山（みせん）の鎮守として祀られたのに始まる。
sen.e: Before Zao Gongen (the principal image of the Kimpusen Zaodo, and the highest worship object of the Shugendo) was enshrined in Mt. Omine, Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine was enshrined as Chinju (local Shinto deity) of Mt. Misen, the highest peak of the mountainous region at first.

Before Zao Gongen (the principal image of the Kimpusen Zaodo, and the highest worship object of Shugendo) was enshrined at Mt. Omine, Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine was founded as the shrine of the chinju (local Shinto deity) of the highest peak of Mt. Misen.

Before Zao Gongen (the principal image of the Kimpusen Zaodo, and the highest worship object of Shugendo) was enshrined at Mt. Omine, Tenkawa Daibenzaiten-sha Shrine was founded as the shrine of the chinju (local Shinto deity) of the highest peak of Mt. Misen.

sen.j: 空海が高野山の開山に先立って大峯山で修行した。
sen.e: Kukai (Kobo Daishi) practiced asceticism in Mt. Omine before founding a temple in Mt. Koya.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。次セルと一文でしたが，天河神社は大峰山ではなく弥山にあるので，空海の修行とつながりません。よって文を分割しました。
sen.e: Kukai (Kobo Daishi) practiced asceticism at Mt. Omine before founding a temple at Mt. Koya.
Kukai (Kobo Daishi) practiced asceticism at Mt. Omine before founding a temple at Mt. Koya.

sen.j: 最大の行場が天河神社であった。
sen.e: Tenkawa-jinja Shrine was the largest ascetic practice place in this district.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Tenkawa-jinja Shrine was the largest place of ascetic practice in the area.
Tenkawa-jinja Shrine was the largest place of ascetic practice in the area.

sen.j: 弘法大師にまつわる遺品が奉納されている。
sen.e: Articles belonged to Kobo Daishi are dedicated.
Articles belonged to Kobo Daishi have been offered to the shrine.
Articles belonged to Kobo Daishi have been offered to the shrine.

sen.j: 1992年、杜撰な資金計画による社殿改築・境内整備が破綻し、破産宣告を受ける。
sen.e: The failure in the projects of rebuilding the shrine main building and maintaining the precincts under the sloppy financial plan resulted in the shrine being adjudicated bankrupt in 1992.
The failure of the projects to rebuild the shrine's main building and maintainin the precinct under a faulty financial plan resulted in the shrine being declared bankrupt in 1992.
The failure of the projects to rebuild the shrine's main building and maintain the precinct under a faulty financial plan resulted in the shrine being declared bankrupt in 1992.
sen.cmt: 余分なin を削除しました。

sen.j: 不動産等が競売にかけられたが買い手がつかなかった。
sen.e: Real estate and others were put up for auction only to remain unsold.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The real estate was put up for auction but remained unsold.
The real estate was put up for auction but remained unsold.

sen.j: 債権の債権放棄によって救済された。
sen.e: In the end, the shrine was relieved because the creditor renounced the claim.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。ウェブでは債権者の債権放棄でしたので訂正しました。
sen.e: In the end, the shrine was saved when the creditor renounced the claim.
In the end, the shrine was saved when the creditor renounced the claim.

sen.j: 施設
sen.e: Facilities
Facilities
Facilities

sen.j: 弥山山頂（1895m）に奥院がある。
sen.e: Oku-no-in is at the summit of Mt. Misen (1895m).
Oku-no-in is at the summit of Mt. Misen (1895m).
Oku-no-in is at the summit of Mt. Misen (1895m).

sen.j: 能との縁が深く、能の関係の品物が多く奉納され保管されている。
sen.e: As the shrine has been closely associated with Nohgaku, a lot of items related to Nohgaku that were dedicated to the shrine are kept.
As the shrine has been closely associated with nohgaku, many items related to nohgaku that have been dedicated to the shrine are kept there.
As the shrine has been closely associated with nohgaku, many items related to nohgaku that have been dedicated to the shrine are kept there.

sen.j: 行事
sen.e: Events
Events
Events

sen.j: 主なもの
sen.e: The main events
Main events
Main events

sen.j: 1月1日：歳旦祭
sen.e: January 1: Saitansai Festival (Saitansai is a Shinto ritual to mark the beginning of New Year, followed by a special sharing of sake in the barrel and a rice cake pounding ceremony)
January 1: Saitansai Festival (Saitansai is a Shinto ritual to mark the beginning of New Year, followed by a special sharing of sake in the barrel and a rice cake pounding ceremony)
January 1: Saitansai Festival (Saitansai is a Shinto ritual to mark the beginning of New Year, followed by a special sharing of sake in the barrel and a rice cake pounding ceremony)

sen.j: 1月17日：牛王行事
sen.e: January 17: Goo Festival (a festival to distribute Goo talismans)
January 17: Goo Festival (a festival to distribute Goo talismans)
January 17: Goo Festival (a festival to distribute Goo talismans)

sen.j: 2月3日：節分祭
sen.e: February 3: Setsubun Festival (the bean-throwing festival of celebrating the coming of spring)
February 3: Setsubun Festival (the bean-throwing festival of celebrating the coming of spring)
February 3: Setsubun Festival (the bean-throwing festival of celebrating the coming of spring)

sen.j: 7月16日、7月17日：例大祭
sen.e: July 16, 17: Reitai-sai Festival
July 16, 17: Reitai-sai Festival
July 16, 17: Reitai-sai Festival

sen.j: 11月2日：秋の大祭
sen.e: November 2: Autumn Festival
November 2: Autumn Festival
November 2: Autumn Festival

sen.j: 交通
sen.e: Traffic
Access
Access

sen.j: 近鉄吉野線下市口駅より奈良交通バス。
sen.e: By public transportation: Take a bus of Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd from the Kintetsu Yoshino Line Shimoichiguchi station.
Bus operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd from Shimoichiguchi Station on the Kintetsu Yoshino Line.
Bus operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd from Shimoichiguchi Station on the Kintetsu Yoshino Line.

sen.j: 国道309号を南下、天川川合交叉点を右折。
sen.e: By car: Go south the National Route 309 and turn right at the Tenkawa-Kawai Crossing.
Drive south on National Route 309 and turn right at the Tenkawa-Kawai Intersection.
Drive south on National Route 309 and turn right at the Tenkawa-Kawai Intersection.
